content: We have found out today that so many wars in our societies today are caused by individuals with political ambitions,and such individuals are always ready to go any length in ensuring they are in power,therefore,they do not care who's life is lost in their quest for political power.The poor masses seems to be at the suffering end when two people of this calibre with the ambition of getting into power,antagonise each other politically. If I may ask,why do people always want to  create chaox in the society during politics?

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: martyns on November 29, 2022, 03:32:17 AMWe have found out today that so many wars in our societies today are caused by individuals with political ambitions,and such individuals are always ready to go any length in ensuring they are in power,therefore,they do not care who's life is lost in their quest for political power.The poor masses seems to be at the suffering end when two people of this calibre with the ambition of getting into power,antagonise each other politically. If I may ask,why do people always want to  create chaox in the society during politics?Greed and uncontrollable hunger for power is the reason why some politicians would do anything to grab political power. They don't care how many people loose their lives or the level of destruction their actions or inaction might bring because they are power drunk. Apart from Donald Trump and few other most politicians in Western Europe and the US are matured enough to accept defeat and relinquish power. Some of them even resign if they perceive that they have lost the confidence of the people. But my continent has the highest number of greedy politicians that are always desperate to grab or retain power by all means. You would hardly hear that an African politician resigned from political office. The hold tight to power as if it is their personal property. But the greatest politician in my locality is Nelson Mandela, who even when he was persuaded to remain in power, decided to serve for just one term. The war in Ethiopia, Sudan and Eritrea has the same undertone; political ambition of greedy politicians.But sometimes I blame the masses for supporting these politicians in their quest to destroy the country. Politicians always use tribal and religious sentiments to brainwash the people and instigate against their own fellow countrymen. These politicians pretend as if they a fighting for the rights of the people while they are merely fighting for their personal ambition or bank accounts.

comments.body: Well, I don't think anyone would put effort in something that would yield no profit; hence the need by individuals to do absurd things. comments.author: rahmad2nd
comments.body: In this post, I just want to highlight about the war. and there is a definition of war by experts. The existing definition continues to  change in line with the times that bring new forms of conflict between countries. I remember one of the figures who is famous for his writings about war, Clausewitz is a figure from the 18th century so that his works such as "On War", refer to what happened in his time.  Clausewitz views that war always has an objective.no one starting a war or rather no one starting a war with common sense should do so without first having it clear in his mind what he wants to achieve in that war and how he is going to do it. to achieve what they want, war is often the way they choose "politicians, or a country". According to Clausewitz, war is an act of violence intended to force the opponent to do what we want. violence that occurs in war, is not the main goal for the state. Countries do not go to war just for the sake of destroying opponents, but have other goals. so, war is nothing but a tool used to paralyze the enemy. Putting the opponent in a position of pressure is the ultimate goal of war because under these conditions, the state can enforce the importance it wants.well, so in essence the occurrence of all the conflicts that exist on this earth is an interest of a group or country.

comments.author: Lordhermes
comments.body: Power, which is what politics is, is taken, not given. The majority of politicians are unaware of what it takes to assume power. The majority of people in this region of the world, most of whom are from Africa, view elections as battles to further their political objectives. They create problems and misunderstanding among voters, which can occasionally result in anarchy and bloodshed in the neighborhood.The majority of those who have nothing to offer the populace and have allowed their desires to generate crises in society. It is a known fact that during elections in Africa, people picnic and some stay on the road until afterward due to the ambition of some corrupt politicians who view politics as a matter of life and death. As a result, they use their Evi plan to incite conflict in our society.

comments.author: Marykeller
comments.body: In our society, especially in African nations, the desire for wealth and power by individuals is unbelievable. They must now involve a tribal or religious war in the election's cause since it is a life-or-death situation for a particular tribe to run above every other tribe in the country. It is quite depressing that the so-called political aspirant now tends to forget the reason they went for office in the first place (to rule), only to incite a civil war in the community through the youth when they lost to their opponent.
